definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Thy Lord knows best, and He has the clouds and the sun at His disposal. --Selected.
sentences.chinese: 你的主無所不知，雲和太陽，都受他的使喚與調節。

sentences.english: They can seperate facts from opinions and don't pretend to have all the answers.
sentences.chinese: 他們釐得清事實與觀點，不會佯言無所不知。

sentences.english: And he pretends to be omniscient.
sentences.chinese: 他還裝出一副無所不知的樣子。

sentences.english: Oh my gosh! People thought I was such a know-it-all just because I got good grades.
sentences.chinese: 遭了，因爲得到好成績，人們會認爲我無所不知。
他是一個自稱無所不知的人。

sentences.english: There is nothing I, Ape-Man Daniel.
sentences.chinese: 我人猿泰牛是無所不知的。

sentences.english: Now, of course, we know everything about the universe.
sentences.chinese: 現在，當然，我們又對宇宙無所不知。

sentences.english: No man can acquaint himself with everything on this earth, he said.
sentences.chinese: 地球上沒有人無所不知，他說。

sentences.english: Your mom knows best. Good dance always cheers me up.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽無所不知，跳舞總能令我精神振奮。

sentences.english: This is why he wall called Mr. Know-all.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼他被稱爲無所不知先生。

sentences.english: Google is the closest thing to an Omniscient (all-knowing) entity in existence, which can be scientifically verified.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌是經科學驗證最接近於無所不知的。

sentences.english: Perhaps a know-all doesn't live on the earth.
sentences.chinese: 也許世上沒有無所不知的人。

sentences.english: A boss knows all, a leader asks questions.
sentences.chinese: 老闆無所不知，領袖知人善任。
人非聖賢，安能無所不知。
不要表現出無所不知的樣子。

sentences.english: Therewas nothing he didn't know about that golden age of music.
sentences.chinese: 音樂史上的那段黃金歲月，他無所不知。

definition: virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
to be reluctant to give up a post
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
